title: Reform swaggered into Caerphilly, ready for a coronation. An unpleasant surprise lay in store | Will Hayward
summary: Predictions of a Reform party victory in the recent byelection were inaccurate, highlighting unexpected electoral dynamics. Labour's significant defeat serves as a wake-up call, providing crucial insights for the party's future strategies. Guardian columnist Will Hayward emphasizes the need for both parties to reevaluate their positions and approaches.

title: Trump says all trade negotiations with Canada ‘terminated’ over an anti-tariff advertising campaign – US politics live
summary: The US president has halted negotiations in response to an advertisement showing Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs. This move appears to be a direct reaction to the negative portrayal of his trade policies. The decision underscores rising tensions surrounding tariff discussions.

title: Plaid Cymru celebrates ‘historic’ Caerphilly byelection after fending off Reform and Labour – UK politics live
summary: Lindsay Whittle has successfully won the Senedd constituency from Labour, marking a significant political shift. He also faced a strong challenge from Reform UK but managed to hold his ground. This victory highlights a changing landscape in Welsh politics.

title: Meta found in breach of EU law over ‘ineffective’ complaints system for flagging illegal content
summary: The European Commission has found that Facebook and Instagram implemented unnecessary procedures for users attempting to submit reports. This observation suggests potential compliance issues with EU regulations. The issue highlights ongoing scrutiny of social media platforms regarding user accessibility and transparency.

title: Sheffield Wednesday face 12-point deduction, Slot backs Salah to find form: football – live
summary: A team of writers is preparing to cover a busy weekend across various leagues. They will provide ongoing updates and reports throughout the events. The anticipation for the matches is building as the weekend approaches.
